thread.title: Hornets still undefeated; Cavs strike
thread.title_full: Hornets still undefeated; Cavs strike | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: AP
title: Hornets still undefeated; Cavs strike
text:
by AP
October 20, 2015 Charlotte, N.C. — Kemba Walker scored 22 points, Jeremy Lin added 18 points and eight rebounds, and the Charlotte Hornets defeated the Chicago Bulls, 94-86, on Monday night to remain undefeated in the preseason.
The Hornets (6-0) also got 11 points from P.J. Hairston in his first game back from a calf injury.
Jimmy Butler had 18 points, but was 0 for 4 from 3-point range while Taj Gibson had a preseason-high 14 points on 6-of-7 shooting along with nine rebounds. Chicago was 6 of 27 from beyond the 3-point arc.
Pau Gasol had the night off for the Bulls while Jeremy Lamb left the game with a sprained right ankle and did not return. It’s unclear how long he’ll be out.
Joakim Noah, on the other hand, recorded his first double-double of the preseason with 12 points and 13 rebounds.
CAVALIERS 103, MAVS 97
In Cleveland, J.R. Smith scored 19 points and the Cleveland Cavaliers avoided a winless preseason with a 103-97 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.
The Cavaliers, who have had several key players sidelined by injuries in training camp, end the exhibition season with a 1-6 record.
Kevin Love, playing his second preseason game after dislocating his left shoulder in last season’s playoffs, scored 10 points with four rebounds in 23 minutes.
